title: Expand game catalog to support up to 50 games with varied types (funny, hard, etc.)

requirements.text: Expand the frontend game catalog to include up to 50 games by extending `frontend/src/gameRegistry.ts` with additional game entries (most can be marked as not yet playable) and ensure each game has a unique `id`, a clear English `title`, and a short English `description` that can reflect types such as “funny” or “hard”.

quotes: Add a maximum 50 games funny, Hart, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: `GAME_REGISTRY` contains more games than today and can scale up to 50 total entries without duplicate `id` values.
At least some new games have descriptions that clearly indicate “funny” and/or “hard” types in English.
Existing playable games (Tic-Tac-Toe, Reaction Timer, Word Scramble) remain playable and unchanged in behavior.

requirements.text: Update the game metadata model so the catalog can represent types like “funny” and “hard” without breaking existing pages. Add optional fields to `GameInfo` (e.g., `tags` and/or `difficulty`) and update the Hub, Game Shell, and All Leaderboards pages to display these fields when present.

quotes: Add a maximum 50 games funny, Hart, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: TypeScript compiles with no errors after extending `GameInfo` and updating all usages.
Hub game cards still show category, and additionally show tags/difficulty when present (in English).
AllLeaderboardsPage continues to list playable games and is not affected by the presence of additional non-playable games with new metadata.

requirements.text: Ensure the Hub UI remains usable with a large catalog (up to 50 games) by adding basic discovery controls on the hub screen: a text search (by title) and a category filter (using existing `category` values).

quotes: Add a maximum 50 games funny, Hart, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: Hub page includes a search input that filters visible games by title as the user types.
Hub page includes a category filter that narrows the grid to selected category (with an option to show all).
With 50 registered games, the hub page remains readable and navigable (no broken layout, no overlapping cards).

requirements.text: Add a lightweight runtime/dev validation for the registry to enforce the “maximum 50 games” constraint and prevent common configuration errors (e.g., length > 50, duplicate IDs).

quotes: Add a maximum 50 games funny, Hart, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: If `GAME_REGISTRY.length` exceeds 50, the app surfaces a clear warning in the browser console during development (and does not crash).
If duplicate game IDs exist, the app surfaces a clear warning in the browser console during development (and does not crash).
When the registry is valid (<= 50 and unique IDs), no warnings are shown.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (shadcn components); compose them as-is.
Do not edit files listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Implementing 50 fully playable games (new entries may be “Coming Soon”).
Adding new authentication methods beyond Internet Identity.
Adding new backend persistence structures specifically for game categories/tags/difficulty (keep this as frontend metadata unless explicitly required later).
